sentences.en: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.cn: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.en: "How's Jan?" she asked. — "Bad. As you might expect."
sentences.cn: “简怎么样？”她问道。——“如你所料，情况不好。”

sentences.en: "I expect you're right." — "Of course I'm right."
sentences.cn: “我想你是对的。”——“我当然是对的。”

sentences.en: "What did you expect me to do about it?" she demanded.
sentences.cn: “对此你期望我怎么办？”她质问道。

sentences.en: "Will Joe be here at Christmas?" — "I expect so."
sentences.cn: “圣诞节时乔会来这里吗？”——“我想会的。”

sentences.en: an expected crowd of 80,000 people
sentences.cn: 预计会来80,000人

sentences.en: Don't expect me to come and visit you there.
sentences.cn: 别指望我会去那儿看你。

sentences.en: He didn’t get his expected pay rise.
sentences.cn: 他没有得到他预想的加薪。

sentences.en: he had a few lines about the eyes, but at forty-seven that was only to be expected.
sentences.cn: 他两眼周围有一些皱纹，不过四十七岁的人了，这也是正常的。

sentences.en: He wasn't expecting our hospitality.
sentences.cn: 他没有期待我们的热情款待。

sentences.en: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.cn: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.en: How can you expect me to believe your promises?
sentences.cn: 你怎能指望我相信你的承诺？

sentences.en: I expected her to be taller than me, not shorter.
sentences.cn: 我曾以为她个子比我高，不会比我矮。

sentences.en: I'm a natural pessimist; I usually expect the worst.
sentences.cn: 我是天生的悲观主义者。我总是做最坏的打算。

sentences.en: It is wishful thinking to expect deeper change under his leadership.
sentences.cn: 指望在他的领导下发生更深层次的变革简直是痴心妄想。

sentences.en: Mr Stocks can expect a gruelling week on the publicity treadmill.
sentences.cn: 斯托克斯先生可以预见下一周会被枯燥繁重的宣传工作搞得焦头烂额。

sentences.en: People can't expect him to wave a magic wand.
sentences.cn: 人民不能指望他创造奇迹。

sentences.en: Snow is expected by the weekend.
sentences.cn: 预计周末会下雪。

sentences.en: Some firms expect the guards to work twelve hours a day.
sentences.cn: 有些公司要求保安每天工作12小时。

sentences.en: The Macmillan Guide had forewarned me of what to expect.
sentences.cn: 《麦克米伦指南》已经事先告诫过我会遇到什么情况。

sentences.en: The officer expects complete obedience from his troops.
sentences.cn: 这位军官要求部下绝对服从。

sentences.en: They've been giving broad hints about what to expect.
sentences.cn: 他们对将会出现什么情况已作了明白的暗示。

sentences.en: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.cn: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

sentences.en: We’re expecting Alison home any minute now.
sentences.cn: 我们想艾利森现在随时会到家。

sentences.en: You cannot expect to like all the people you will work with.
sentences.cn: 不要指望你会喜欢所有和你共事的人。

sentences.en: You will learn what to expect as your child matures physically.
sentences.cn: 在孩子身体发育成熟时，你就知道会发生什么事了。

words.tran_cn: 期待的；怀孕的；预期中的

trans.tran_cn: 预期，盼望，料想，指望，怀孕
trans.tran_en: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

trans.tran_cn: 期待， 盼望； 认为； 预料， 预计…可能发生； 要求， 认为…必要
trans.tran_en: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned
